item.title: SC to decide fate of coal blocks today top companies keep their fingers crossed
item.description: Indias top private and government companies in key industries power steel and cement are keeping their fingers crossed fearing cancellation of coal mines allotted to them years ago
item.itunes:subtitle: Indias top private and government companies in key industries power steel and cement are keeping their fingers crossed fearing cancellation of coal mines allotted to them years ago
item.itunes:summary: Indias top private and government companies in key industries power steel and cement are keeping their fingers crossed fearing cancellation of coal mines allotted to them years ago

item.title: Ambani among participants in Make in India programme
item.description: Leading industrialists including Reliance industries limited chief Mukesh Ambani Essar Group chairman Shashi Ruia and many other global and domestic CEOs will participate in Prime Minister Narendra Modis ambitious Make in India campaign launch at New Delhi on Thursday
item.itunes:subtitle: Leading industrialists including Reliance industries limited chief Mukesh Ambani Essar Group chairman Shashi Ruia and many other global and domestic CEOs will participate in Prime Minister Narendra Modis ambitious Make in India campaign launch at New Delh
item.itunes:summary: Leading industrialists including Reliance industries limited chief Mukesh Ambani Essar Group chairman Shashi Ruia and many other global and domestic CEOs will participate in Prime Minister Narendra Modis ambitious Make in India campaign launch at New Delhi on Thursday

item.title: Cabinet to clear Clean India plan before PMs trip
item.description: A day before Prime Minister Narendra Modi leaves for the US the cabinet on Wednesday is set to clear the Swachch Bharat scheme that aims to have a toilet in every household and create a clean India by 2019
item.itunes:subtitle: A day before Prime Minister Narendra Modi leaves for the US the cabinet on Wednesday is set to clear the Swachch Bharat scheme that aims to have a toilet in every household and create a clean India by 2019
item.itunes:summary: A day before Prime Minister Narendra Modi leaves for the US the cabinet on Wednesday is set to clear the Swachch Bharat scheme that aims to have a toilet in every household and create a clean India by 2019

item.title: After TV interview PM to make a radio debut
item.description: Close on the heels of his first TV interview as PM Narendra Modi will now debut on Radio on October 3 Modi will share his thoughts on a variety of issues with the people of India through the radio said an official press release
item.itunes:subtitle: Close on the heels of his first TV interview as PM Narendra Modi will now debut on Radio on October 3 Modi will share his thoughts on a variety of issues with the people of India through the radio said an official press release
item.itunes:summary: Close on the heels of his first TV interview as PM Narendra Modi will now debut on Radio on October 3 Modi will share his thoughts on a variety of issues with the people of India through the radio said an official press release

item.title: India expands boundaries of knowledge with Mars Orbiter Mission
item.description: The success of Mangalyaan in achieving the desired orbit around Mars shows great maturity in space science and technology that India has achieved It will lend credence to what PM Narendra Modi has said that India can be the Walmart for space technology for the world writes Dr Kumar Krishen
item.itunes:subtitle: The success of Mangalyaan in achieving the desired orbit around Mars shows great maturity in space science and technology that India has achieved It will lend credence to what PM Narendra Modi has said that India can be the Walmart for space technology fo
item.itunes:summary: The success of Mangalyaan in achieving the desired orbit around Mars shows great maturity in space science and technology that India has achieved It will lend credence to what PM Narendra Modi has said that India can be the Walmart for space technology for the world writes Dr Kumar Krishen

item.title: VIPs should inform us of foreign trips
item.description: Following a home ministry directive the Delhi police has told its protectees numbering almost 250 to inform it before leaving for foreign travels in order to facilitate better coordination with foreign agencies
item.itunes:subtitle: Following a home ministry directive the Delhi police has told its protectees numbering almost 250 to inform it before leaving for foreign travels in order to facilitate better coordination with foreign agencies
item.itunes:summary: Following a home ministry directive the Delhi police has told its protectees numbering almost 250 to inform it before leaving for foreign travels in order to facilitate better coordination with foreign agencies

item.title: Law panel to discuss privacy defamation in convention on media law
item.description: Contempt of court defamation trial by media privacy and paid news are some of the issues to be discussed threadbare at a consultation on media law organised by the Law Commission this weekend
item.itunes:subtitle: Contempt of court defamation trial by media privacy and paid news are some of the issues to be discussed threadbare at a consultation on media law organised by the Law Commission this weekend
item.itunes:summary: Contempt of court defamation trial by media privacy and paid news are some of the issues to be discussed threadbare at a consultation on media law organised by the Law Commission this weekend

item.title: Bihar CM Manjhi praises Nitish at LSE event
item.description: Harping on JD U leader Nitish Kumars contribution to turning Bihar around chief minister Jitan Lal Manjhi told an audience at the London School of Economics LSE that the state needed private investment to retain its position as the fastest growing state in India
item.itunes:subtitle: Harping on JD U leader Nitish Kumars contribution to turning Bihar around chief minister Jitan Lal Manjhi told an audience at the London School of Economics LSE that the state needed private investment to retain its position as the fastest growing state i
item.itunes:summary: Harping on JD U leader Nitish Kumars contribution to turning Bihar around chief minister Jitan Lal Manjhi told an audience at the London School of Economics LSE that the state needed private investment to retain its position as the fastest growing state in India

item.title: China asks for flag meet to ease tension
item.description: Chinas Peoples Liberation Army has sought a flag meeting with the Indian Army amidst the continuing standoff in the sensitive Ladakh sector a move that could help ease tensions along the Line of Actual Control LAC
item.itunes:subtitle: Chinas Peoples Liberation Army has sought a flag meeting with the Indian Army amidst the continuing standoff in the sensitive Ladakh sector a move that could help ease tensions along the Line of Actual Control LAC
item.itunes:summary: Chinas Peoples Liberation Army has sought a flag meeting with the Indian Army amidst the continuing standoff in the sensitive Ladakh sector a move that could help ease tensions along the Line of Actual Control LAC

item.title: Will take to the street with a broom Modi
item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi who is on his maiden visit to the state capital after he took charge drew attention to Bengalurus massive garbage crisis that has had the Siddaramaiah government in a bind for the last six months
item.itunes:subtitle: Prime Minister Narendra Modi who is on his maiden visit to the state capital after he took charge drew attention to Bengalurus massive garbage crisis that has had the Siddaramaiah government in a bind for the last six months
item.itunes:summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi who is on his maiden visit to the state capital after he took charge drew attention to Bengalurus massive garbage crisis that has had the Siddaramaiah government in a bind for the last six months

item.title: Its a record Mamata poems on album ahead of Durga Puja
item.description: A local band plans to release an album with 15 selected poems of West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee The album is titled Mukta Akash and will be released before the Durga Puja
item.itunes:subtitle: A local band plans to release an album with 15 selected poems of West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee The album is titled Mukta Akash and will be released before the Durga Puja
item.itunes:summary: A local band plans to release an album with 15 selected poems of West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee The album is titled Mukta Akash and will be released before the Durga Puja

item.title: Cylinder blast rips apart bus in Bulandshahr 11 killed
item.description: Eleven people were killed and many more injured when a passenger lit a cigarette causing an LPG cylinder to burst inside a bus near Bulandshahr in Uttar Pradesh police officials said on Tuesday

item.title: India rejects US proposal on phasing out refrigerant coolants
item.description: India has rejected the US offer to provide clean technologies for low carbon growth only if the Modi government agreed to phase out existing refrigerant coolants called Hydrofluorocarbons HFCs which cause global warming

item.title: Thrust on biz meetings to attract investors to India
item.description: As officials put final touches to the Prime Ministers US visit it emerges he is starting with a meeting with a Nobel laureate an oncologist and ending with another the president
item.itunes:subtitle: As officials put final touches to the Prime Ministers US visit it emerges he is starting with a meeting with a Nobel laureate an oncologist and ending with another the president
item.itunes:summary: As officials put final touches to the Prime Ministers US visit it emerges he is starting with a meeting with a Nobel laureate an oncologist and ending with another the president

item.title: China seeks flag meet amid lingering border standoff
item.description: The Peoples Liberation Army has sought a flag meeting with the Indian Army amidst the continuing standoff in the sensitive Ladakh sector a move that could help ease tensions along the disputed border
item.itunes:subtitle: The Peoples Liberation Army has sought a flag meeting with the Indian Army amidst the continuing standoff in the sensitive Ladakh sector a move that could help ease tensions along the disputed border
item.itunes:summary: The Peoples Liberation Army has sought a flag meeting with the Indian Army amidst the continuing standoff in the sensitive Ladakh sector a move that could help ease tensions along the disputed border
